mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Betsey Mason to Margaret Sweat, 1872 August 10
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Mason, Betsey (Elizabeth Price), 1802-1873
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from Betsey Mason, Vice Regent for Virginia, to Margaret Sweat, Vice Regent for Maine, August 10, 1872. Chesnut Hill, Loudon County. Deterioration of Miss Cunningham's health. Has advised her to accept the will of the Vice Regents. Thinks Miss McMakin has been a bad influence on her. McMakin's family, especially the mother, is a "horror." Cunningham is willing to give all money control over to Hollingsworth. Attempts to get her away from Mount Vernon.
